page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW
page.content: This area is not a naturally unified one. It comprises part of BARTON UNDER NEEDWOOD, the whole of WYCHNOR and part of ALREWAS. A major obstacle to move- ment across the area is the barrier formed by the main railway line, A38 road and Trent & Mersey Canal. These run parallel and in close proximity to each other. There are large areas of farm land. The villages are now large- ly dormitories for workers in local towns. There is one large historic house and park, and many other smaller old houses. There is some modern building. There are three churches, three pubs and two restaurants. There are two motels. The gravel pits are the most noticeable industry but there are many other small businesses. Two old school buildings are now used for other purposes. Wychnor is the site of of a medieval deserted village.
